column4: this might sound kinda dum.. but how do I install ubuntu onto hdd from the "live cd" ??
so .. uh .. it's positivley impossible then?? I cant copy the kernel image onto hdd as well as all the data files?
it's not designed to be installed from; maybe you can hack it, but I have no idea how. Probably more trouble than it's worth
*oh well* - I wonder why they don't put the install disk on those "toasters"
i thought they did (not that i've used one). Which one did you use?
Port Elizabeth.. It's only got the live CD
oh, i see you're right. that is very silly
there aren't even any requests for it here: http://www.freedomtoaster.org/?q=node/29
oh, hang on. if i look at this page: http://www.freedomtoaster.org/?q=node/29   the implication is that the hoary CD is there
Ubuntu Warty, Hoary and Hoary Live CD -- i read that as everything but Warty Live CD
i've never used one, as i said, so i don't know. my suspicion is that you did miss something. Not having the install CD would be a very odd, given who is funding the toaster.
Yea I guess...  I'll go have another look as soon as I get the chance
i'm waiting for breezy to be released to try it
fairly easy to use? general impressions?
Oh yes, something like an ATM, just poke, poke, insert cd, and zip!
cool. i'm tempted to go just to try it out ;)
Actually that's probably why I iniatially went ;)
